Described Disease.Described Disease: Parkinson's disease and dementia with Lewy bodies

Material used.Description: Recombinant GST-fusion protein of human a-synuclein, A30P a-synuclein, E46K a-synuclein and A53T a-synuclein.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: increased ability to bind to negatively charged liposomes
Readout description.Result Description: Mutation E46K increased the binding of a-synuclein to type A liposomes by 88% and to type B liposomes by 56%.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: reduced binding to negatively charged liposomes
Readout description.Result Description: Mutation A30P reduced the binding of a-synuclein to type A liposomes by 95% and to type B liposomes by 53%.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: No significant effect on the ability of a-synuclein to bind to lipid membranes
Readout description.Result Description: Mutation A53T led to a non-significant 9-12% reduction in the binding of a-synuclein to both liposome types.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent protein preparations, each run in duplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein was used as a control.

Basic negative control.Description: GST bound to glutathione-agarose gave a figure for non-specific binding.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Means ± S.E.M. of the measurements obtained from three independent protein preparations, each run in duplicate.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Binding of wild-type a-synuclein taken as 100%.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from wild-type binding levels.

Material used.Description: Untagged a-synuclein proteins were used at 400 μM in 30 mM Mops, pH 7.2, containing 0.02% sodium azide and 20 μM thioflavin T.

Readout description.Result Description: E46K a-synuclein showed a faster rate of assembly and a 2.5-fold greater total assembly than the wild-type protein at 98 h.
The rate of assembly of the A30P mutant was slower than for wild-type a-synuclein, but the amount of assembly was similar to that of the E46K and A53T mutants at 98 h.
The A53T mutant behaved in a similar way to E46K a-synuclein.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein was used as a control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Means ± S.E.M. of the measurements obtained from three independent protein preparations.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Assembly of wild-type a-synuclein taken as reference.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Significant deviation from wild-type assembly levels.
